conclusion: Understanding the problem setup and conditions from the figure
Square metal coil with side length L and N turns, rotating with angular velocity ω around axis OO', perpendicular to magnetic field B, side ab at distance L/4 from axis
Determine the magnetic flux through the coil as a function of time
Magnetic flux through the coil is Φ_B = BL^2cos(ωt) for N turns, Φ_total = NBL^2cos(ωt)
Calculate the induced EMF using Faraday's law, resulting in ε = NBL^2ωsin(ωt)
Determine the effective (RMS) value of the induced EMF, ε_eff = NBL^2ω/√2
Reconsider the problem due to axis of rotation not passing through the center
Recalculate considering the actual position of the axis, setting up a coordinate system
Calculate the component of the area vector perpendicular to the magnetic field, resulting in Φ_B = NBL^2sin(ωt)
Induced EMF recalculated as ε = -NBL^2ωcos(ωt), ε_max = NBL^2ω, and ε_eff = NBL^2ω/√2
Final answer: The effective value of the induced electromotive force in the coil is ε_eff = NBL^2ω/√2
